channel.title: Updates: Collective Bargaining Notices (FMCS F-7) [Records Request]
channel.description: Updates on the Data Liberation Project's Collective Bargaining Notices (FMCS F-7) request

item.title: Appeal Denied
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On March 7, 2024, FMCS denied our appeal üìÑ, determining that the redactions applied to the records were justified and that “identifiers were not withheld, rather they did not exist.”

item.title: Appeal Filed
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On February 9, 2024, we submitted an appeal üìÑ to FMCS regarding this case.

item.title: Initial Response Received, Records Largely Withheld
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On January 10, 2024, FMCS emailed its response to our request üìÑ. The agency provided a large CSV file, with most of its content redacted, arguing that (1) ‚Äúsome of the records are exempt‚Äù via a ‚Äúmediation privilege‚Äù, and (2) ‚Äúsome responsive records constitute confidential commercial or financial information‚Äù. The remaining, non-withheld records appear to be those already available through the F-7 spreadsheets FMCS already publishes online.

item.title: Second Request Acknowledgment
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On October 27, 2023, FMCS emailed a letter üìÑ acknowledging this request and assigning it tracking number FOIA-2024-00009.

item.title: Request Acknowledged
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On September 11, 2023, FMCS sent an email acknowledging this request and assigning it tracking number FOIA-2023-00045.
